author: @Frida_22-l
text: What is your opinion former Swedish prime minister Olaf Palme and Finland president Urho Kekkonen? Both were popular leaders in their life time and this day their are popular. Palme supported Vietnam with humanitarian aid, but was critical of the US and Soviet Union. Kekkonen was reason why Finland becomed wealthy countrie and hi had good relations with both US and USSR. Sadly legacy of Kekkonen is ruined by elite, bankers and ruling class.

replies.author: @NewCaliforniaSSR
replies.text: No Huey or Davis. He excused Malcom X and Dr. King by saying they weren't communists, which is true, and then didn't say a single thing about Davis. Stating that it "doesn't feel right" to rank Huey when he was happy to rank Gonzolo, I think, speaks quite loudly. I think most videos I've seen on this channel seems to imply that Marxist-Leninists who are openly queer are also somehow liberals, but i haven't really watched a lot of this channel.

replies.author: @hargyd0n
replies.text:
@NewCaliforniaSSR It is important to note that when identity politics starts to get integrated into the program, things start to detract. It's not a coincidence the CIA pushed such lines through the Congress for Cultural Freedom. There is a difference between ideology and identity of an individual, identity politics takes on the former principle, and is dangerous for movements focused on class struggle because it fosters division and sectarianism, which is why the Left is a basket case in the West right now.

Midwestern Marx rejects identity politics but welcomes people of all identities, same with the ACP. Hope you can understand.
